dealt

Whose turn is it to deal?
Start by dealing out ten cards to each player.

data.enText: He dealt me two aces.

to buy and sell illegal drugs

data.chText: 经常可以看到一些人在大街上公然买卖毒品。
data.enText: You can often see people dealing openly on the streets.

deal a blow to sb/sth

data.enText: to be very shocking or harmful to sb/sth

data.enText: Her sudden death dealt a blow to the whole country.

wheel and deal

to accept sth as a basis for your decisions, attitudes, or actions

data.enText: We don't deal in rumours or guesswork.
deal sb in

data.enText: to include sb in an activity

data.chText: 这听起来太棒了。算我一个！
data.enText: That sounds great. Deal me in!
deal sth↔out
to share sth out among a group of people
The profits were dealt out among the investors.
to say what punishment sb should have

data.chText: 许多法官对男性比对女性的判决更严厉。
data.enText: Many judges deal out harsher sentences to men than to women.
deal with sb
to take appropriate action in a particular situation or according to who you are talking to, managing, etc.

data.chText: 她已习惯于和工作中遇到的各种各样的人打交道。
data.enText: She is used to dealing with all kinds of people in her job.
deal with sb/sth
to do business with a person, a company or an organization
deal with sth
to solve a problem, perform a task, etc.

data.chText: 处理各种询问 / 问题 / 投诉
data.enText: to deal with enquiries/issues/complaints
Have you dealt with these letters yet?

to be about sth

data.chText: 她的诗经常涉及死亡这一主题。
data.enText: Her poems often deal with the subject of death.
a lot
much; a lot
They spent a great deal of money.
It took a great deal of time.
I'm feeling a good deal better.
We see them a great deal (= often) .
business agreement
an agreement, especially in business, on particular conditions for buying or doing sth
to make/sign/conclude/close a deal (with sb)
Did you cut a deal (= make one) ?

data.chText: 我们与资方在加班问题上达成了一项协议。
data.enText: We did a deal with the management on overtime.

data.chText: 他们希望达成一项提高工资的协议。
data.enText: They were hoping for a better pay deal.

data.chText: 经过漫长的谈判终于达成了协议。
data.enText: A deal was struck after lengthy negotiations.
The deal fell through (= no agreement was reached) .

data.chText: 我这辆小汽车买得很便宜。
data.enText: I got a good deal on the car (= bought it cheaply) .
It's a deal! (= I agree to your terms)

data.chText: 听着，下面是我们达成的协议。
data.enText: Listen. This is the deal (= this is what we have agreed and are going to do) .
treatment
the way that sb/sth is treated

data.chText: 该党承诺如果当选将给教师更好的待遇。
data.enText: If elected, the party has promised a new deal (= better and fairer treatment) for teachers.

data.chText: 他们知道自己受到了不公正待遇。
data.enText: They knew they'd been given a raw/rough deal (= been treated unfairly) .

data.chText: 我们曾尽力保证每个人都受到公平待遇。
data.enText: We tried to ensure that everyone got a fair deal .

data.chText: 这对任何人来说都是公平合理的。
data.enText: It was a square deal for everyone.
in card games

wood

a deal table

trans: 克制（不快情感）；冷静面对（感情上困难的局面）
与…做买卖；和…有生意往来

tr: the act of apportioning or distributing something
example: the captain was entrusted with the deal of provisions

tr: the act of distributing playing cards
example: the deal was passed around the table clockwise

tr: a particular instance of buying or selling
example: it was a package deal
I had no further trade with him
he's a master of the business deal

tr: an agreement between parties (usually arrived at after discussion) fixing obligations of each
example: he made a bargain with the devil
he rose to prominence through a series of shady deals

tr: the type of treatment received (especially as the result of an agreement)
example: he got a good deal on his car

tr: the cards held in a card game by a given player at any given time
example: I didn't hold a good hand all evening
he kept trying to see my hand

tr: (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
example: a batch of letters
a deal of trouble
a lot of money
he made a mint on the stock market
see the rest of the winners in our huge passel of photos
it must have cost plenty
a slew of journalists
a wad of money

tr: wood that is easy to saw (from conifers such as pine or fir)
a plank of softwood (fir or pine board)
take into consideration for exemplifying purposes
example: Take the case of China
Consider the following case

tr: act on verbally or in some form of artistic expression
example: This book deals with incest
The course covered all of Western Civilization
The new book treats the history of China

tr: do business
offer for sale as for one's livelihood
example: She deals in gold
The brothers sell shoes

tr: sell
example: deal hashish

tr: distribute cards to the players in a game
example: Who's dealing?

tr: give (a specific card) to a player
example: He dealt me the Queen of Spades

tr: give out as one's portion or share
administer or bestow, as in small portions
example: administer critical remarks to everyone present
dole out some money
shell out pocket money for the children
deal a blow to someone
the machine dispenses soft drinks

tr: take action with respect to (someone or something)
example: How are we going to deal with this problem?
The teacher knew how to deal with these lazy students

tr: behave in a certain way towards others
example: He deals fairly with his employees

tr: be in charge of, act on, or dispose of
example: I can deal with this crew of workers
This blender can't handle nuts
She managed her parents' affairs after they got too old

tr: direct the course of
manage or control
example: You cannot conduct business like this

tr: come to terms with
example: We got by on just a gallon of gas
They made do on half a loaf of bread every day

value.def: If you say that you need or have a great deal of or a good deal of a particular thing, you are emphasizing that you need or have a lot of it.

example.ex: ...a great deal of money...
example.tran: 大量的钱

example.ex: I am in a position to save you a good deal of time.
example.tran: 我能够为你节省许多时间。

example.ex: Their lives became a good deal more comfortable...
example.tran: 他们的生活变得舒适多了。

example.ex: He depended a great deal on his wife for support.
example.tran: 他在很大程度上依赖妻子的支持。

example.ex: Although he had never met Geoffrey Hardcastle, he knew a good deal about him.
example.tran: 尽管从没有见过杰弗里·哈德卡斯尔，但他对他知之甚多。

value.def: A deal of something is a lot of it.

example.ex: He had a deal of work to do.
example.tran: 他有许多工作要做。

value.def: If you make a deal ,do a deal, or cut a deal, you complete an agreement or an arrangement with someone, especially in business.

example.ex: Japan will have to do a deal with America on rice imports...
example.tran: 日本将不得不与美国就大米的进口达成一笔交易。

example.ex: The two sides tried and failed to come to a deal...
example.tran: 双方都努力了，但还是没能达成协议。

example.ex: He was involved in shady business deals...
example.tran: 他参与了一些见不得人的商业交易。

example.ex: You're not going to get out of here unless we make a deal.
example.tran: 除非我们达成协议，否则你就别想从这儿出去。

value.def: If a person, company, or shop deals in a particular type of goods, their business involves buying or selling those goods.

example.ex: They deal in antiques...
example.tran: 他们做古董买卖。

example.ex: ...the rights of our citizens to hold and to deal in foreign currency.
example.tran: 我们的公民持有和买卖外汇的权利

value.def: If someone deals illegal drugs, they sell them.

example.ex: I certainly don't deal drugs.
example.tran: 我当然不贩毒。

example.ex: ...his involvement in drug dealing and illegal money laundering.
example.tran: 他参与了贩毒和洗黑钱活动

value.def: If someone has had a bad deal, they have been unfortunate or have been treated unfairly.

example.ex: The people of Liverpool have had a bad deal for many, many years.
example.tran: 利物浦人多年来一直没有得到公正的待遇。

value.def: If you deal playing cards, you give them out to the players in a game of cards.

example.ex: The croupier dealt each player a card, face down...
example.tran: 赌台管理员给每位玩家正面朝下发了一张牌。

example.ex: He once dealt cards in an illegal gambling joint.
example.tran: 他曾经在一个非法赌博点负责发牌。

example.ex: Dalton dealt out five cards to each player.
example.tran: 多尔顿给每个玩家发了 5 张牌。

value.def: If an event deals a blow to something or someone, it causes them great difficulties or makes failure more likely.

example.ex: The summer drought has dealt a heavy blow to the government's economic record...
example.tran: 夏季的干旱已经对政府的经济业绩造成了沉重打击。

example.ex: The French were dealt another blow yesterday when Serge Viars withdrew from the squad.
example.tran: 昨天塞尔日·维亚尔退出该队令法国人又遭遇了一记重击。

value.tran: 沉重打击;对…造成伤害（或损失）

xrsa.xrsa_see: dealings;wheel and deal. a raw deal

trans: 处理；应付；与…打交道；克制（不快情感）；冷静面对（感情上困难的局面）；论述；讨论；涉及；与…做买卖；和…有生意往来
大量之；很大程度；很大贡献
买卖；经营（说明）deal in通常不用于进行体。
划算；好生意；好交易；好买卖；大量
（在纸牌游戏中）发（牌）；给予，予以（惩罚或伤害）
(政府或机构制订的)一揽子协议(或提议)
完成交易；达成交易；达成协议；成交
达成协议；英语俚语；达成交易
